result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake A Reeves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to restitution.  Restitution paid in full for Ryan H.
The Court schedules a separate restitution hearing to address any further restitution that may be requested by the insurance company.
11/28/2016 - COURT SETS RESTITUTION AT ZERO FOR THE INSURANCE COMPANY.
Cash bail applied to costs.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Court DENIES the request for expunction.

No contact with: Ryan H., his family or their residence with the exception of writing a letter of apology to the victim.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  Sentence commencing forthwith.
11/28/2016 - COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR RELEASE TO ATTEND CHURCH, PERFORM COMMUNITY SERVICE AT THE CHURCH AND TO ATTEND ALUMNI CLASSES AT THE 180 DIVERSION PROGRAM.

To be performed as a condition of probation.
11/28/2016 - COURT GRANTS RELEASE FOR DEFENDANT TO PERFORM COMMUNITY SERVICE AT CHURCH.

records.addlTxt: Granting travel out of the Country from 7/22/17 to 7/29/17 signed by Judge Aprahamian 3/27/17.

From Atty Kuhary dated 3/23/17 requesting premission for defendant to travel out of the Country 7/22/17 to 7/29/17.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 3/23/17; Granted.

Defendant Blake A Reeves in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Stephen Joseph Centinario & Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The victim does not appear and has not provided any request for restitution.  The Court sets restitution at zero.   Attorney Kuhary requests the court grant release for the Defendant to alumni classes at the 180 Diversion Program and allow release for church services and to perform community service at the church.  The Court grants the request and the Defendant is to be released to attend church, perform community service at the church and to attend alumni classes at the 180 Diversion Program.  The pastor from the church to provide documentation of community service to Attorney Kuhary and he is to forward the documentation to the Court.
From State to Optum dated 10/25/16 re restitution hearing.
Restitution hearing on November 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Character letter filed.
Character and completion letters.
From 180 Diversion to State dated 10/19/16 re defendant's successful completion of program.
Sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
